column2: We are seeking a Digital HR Specialist to join our team and drive the transformation of our human resources processes through innovative digital solutions     As a Digital HR Specialist, you will be responsible for leveraging technology to streamline HR operations, enhance employee experience, and support organizational objectives         Responsibilities:       Develop and implement digital HR strategies to optimize recruitment, onboarding, performance management, learning and development, and employee engagement processes.     Evaluate and select digital HR tools, platforms, and systems that align with organizational needs and objectives.     Lead the implementation and integration of digital HR solutions, ensuring seamless functionality and user adoption.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, HR, and business stakeholders, to gather requirements and define technology roadmaps.     Customize and configure digital HR platforms to meet specific business requirements, ensuring data integrity and security.     Provide training and support to HR staff and end-users on digital HR tools and processes.     Analyze HR data and metrics to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for continuous improvement.     Stay abreast of emerging trends and best practices in digital HR technology and recommend innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.     Manage vendor relationships and partnerships to ensure the timely delivery of services and solutions.     Monitor and evaluate the performance of digital HR initiatives, making adjustments as needed to achieve desired outcomes. Strong understanding of HR processes and best practices, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.     Experience with project management methodologies and tools, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive projects to successful completion.     Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven recommendations.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.     Demonstrated ability to adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

column2: The Senior Account Manager, Publisher Client Services will play a key role in developing strategies, processes, and communication to drive the success of TripleLift Publishers. This position offers a unique opportunity to significantly impact market growth. The ideal candidate will possess knowledge of publisher monetization strategies, be familiar with industry trends and the marketplace, and have practical experience in establishing and nurturing client relationships. They will take charge and provide guidance to a team, serving as a mentor and leader.         Key Responsibilities:           Foster and Expand Publisher Networks:    Take charge of nurturing and expanding relationships with top-tier publisher accounts. Dive deep into the needs and aspirations of our clients, acting as the primary touchstone for key stakeholders.       Strategic Consultation:    Be knowledgeable of the publisher s ambitions and goals. Offer bespoke, insightful strategies that pave the way to unlocking lucrative revenue opportunities.       Data-Driven Optimisations:    Harness the power of data analytics to unearth and act on optimisation opportunities, ensuring our solutions are always a step ahead.       Product Mastery:    Achieve a high level of expertise in TripleLift s suite of publisher tools and offerings, positioning yourself as the go-to consultant for all things platform-related.       Collaborative Excellence:    Work in lockstep with adjacent teams to bring projects, enhancements, and new supply and product initiatives across the finish line.       Ongoing Education and Support:    Keep the publisher network in the loop with continuous knowledge and updates on the latest product enhancements, ensuring they re always leveraging our newest features to the fullest.       Innovation Advocacy   : Spearhead the adoption of offerings, such as TripleLift Audiences and component-based formats, contributing to our company s initiatives.       Marketplace Integrity   : Uphold the highest standards of marketplace quality within the TripleLift exchange by diligently vetting publisher s ads.txt and sellers.json during the onboarding process, ensuring a clean, trustworthy environment for all.       Responsive Support   : Act on publisher inquiries swiftly and efficiently, demonstrating our commitment to their success and satisfaction.         Requirements         Good knowledge of G-suite (sheets, docs & slides), Excel & Powerpoint (or similar tools) is required;     Understanding and/or experience in digital advertising;     Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally;     Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences;     Strong customer service skills, comfortable working directly with clients and partners as well as internal departments;     Ability to work individually and collaboratively to drive the business forward;     Comfortable taking ownership of projects and showcasing key accomplishments;     Strives for continued learning opportunities to build upon craft;     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;     Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail;     Ability to work quickly and independently with minimal oversight;     Ability to work under pressure and multitask in a fast-paced start-up environment;     Ability to accept feedback and constructive critique positively;     Extremely strong and demonstrable work ethic;     Experience with HTML and CSS is a plus     Proficient in English. Second language is desirable.     At least 5 years of experience
